meanings.definition: To be parallel to something else.
meanings.sent1: The train tracks were parallelling each other perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The road was parallelling the river for miles.
meanings.sent3: The two friends were parallelling each other in their fashion choices.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were parallelling the winding path of the river.
meanings.sent5: The shadows on the ground were parallelling the branches of the trees.

meanings.definition: To move or run alongside something else.
meanings.sent1: The cyclist was parallelling the car on the road.
meanings.sent2: The dog was parallelling its owner as they jogged in the park.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was parallelling the cat on the fence, teasing it.
meanings.sent4: The stream was parallelling the hiking trail, providing a soothing soundtrack.
meanings.sent5: The clouds were parallelling the mountains as they drifted across the sky.

meanings.definition: To be similar or comparable to something else.
meanings.sent1: Her painting was parallelling the style of the famous artist.
meanings.sent2: The new building design was parallelling the architecture of ancient Rome.
meanings.sent3: The two jokes were parallelling each other in their punchlines.
meanings.sent4: His success was parallelling his hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent5: The melody was parallelling the rhythm of the waves crashing on the shore.
